content.body: I'm applying all our resolutions right now, and I'm finally to the binding visibility one, and I have a question.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I'm applying all our resolutions right now, and I'm finally to the binding visibility one, and I have a question.

content.body: So `&`/`|` is simple, as is array patterns; bindings from earlier patterns are visible to later patterns. But what about object matchers?
content.formatted_body: So &/| is simple, as is array patterns; bindings from earlier patterns are visible to later patterns. But what about object matchers?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: So `&`/`|` is simple, as is array patterns; bindings from earlier patterns are visible to later patterns. But what about object matchers?
So &/| is simple, as is array patterns; bindings from earlier patterns are visible to later patterns. But what about object matchers?

content.body: Should `{a, b: ${console.log(a)}}` work? If so, I presume `{b: ${console.log(a)}, a}` wouldn't work? Or should neither work?
content.formatted_body: Should {a, b: ${console.log(a)}} work? If so, I presume {b: ${console.log(a)}, a} wouldn't work? Or should neither work?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Should `{a, b: ${console.log(a)}}` work? If so, I presume `{b: ${console.log(a)}, a}` wouldn't work? Or should neither work?
Should {a, b: ${console.log(a)}} work? If so, I presume {b: ${console.log(a)}, a} wouldn't work? Or should neither work?
